div1.p: Excerpts regard the publication of “Major Walter Reed and the Yellow Fever Commission - A Compilation.” The Smithsonian Institution requests photographs of Walter Reed. The record card is dated January 12, 1911 through September 12, 1911. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, January 12, 1911
div1.p:
7
Jan. 12, 1911.
Senator Robert L.
Owen, U.S. Senate, Wash. D.C. My dear
Senator Owen: As you have already
shown your interest in perpetuating
the memorial of Major Walter Reed by
the introduction last year of S. 8024
for the erection of a statue to him,
the Surgeon General has requested me
to write and ask your assistance for
the same object in a more modest way.

The Surgeon General's Office is
constantly in receipt of requests
from various parts of the country and
occasionally from abroad for litera-
ture describing the work of the Yel-
low Fever Commission, and we have been
accustomed to send various reprints
of articles written by Reed in ans-
wer to such applications. Some of
these, however, are out of print and
the Surgeon General has therefore got-
ten all the publications descriptive
of his work or connected therewith
for publication in a single volume
entitled “Major Walter Reed and the
Yellow Fever Commission - A Compila-
tion.” It will make a thin book of
about 300 pages. The Surgeon General
has, however, no means of publishing
it, and it has occurred to us that
you might get through a resolution
authorizing its publication and dis-
tribution by the Surgeon General. This
office would like about 400 copies
for distribution in addition to those
that might be wanted by Members of
Congress, especially southern Members,
for distribution to their constituents.

Hoping that you can help us out
in this matter and that you are very
well, I am,

Write nothing below this line.
Yours very sincerely,
J.R. Kean.
B.M.I.

petuating the memory of Maj. Walter
Reed, and believes he would be glad
to introduce the Memorial referred to

8
Jan. 17, 1911.
The Director, Smith-
sonian Institution, Wash. D.C. Sir: The
various articIes by Major Walter Reed, U.S.A.,
and the Yellow Fever Commission as
well as some other articles intimate-
ly associated with this subject are
now being compiled in this office
with the intention of publishing
them in one volume. In the report
of the Smithsonian Institution for
the year 1905, plate I is a photograph
of the Schuler bust of Walter Reed.
We would like very much to have a
copy of this photograph in our publi-
cation. If you can either furnish
this office with a copy of the same
or with the plate from which it is
printed, it would be much appreciated.
G.H.T., S.G., U.S.A.

7-A
Jan. 26, 1911.
Mr. Charles Mercer,
Secretary to Senator Robert L. Owen,
Senate Office Bldg. (Room 339)
Dear Mr. Mercer: In accordance with
the suggestion in your kind note of
Jan. 16, I am sending herewith the
manuscript of the Compilation on Maj.
Walter Reed and the Yellow Fever Com-
mission which the Surgeon General
desires that Mr. Owen will have pub-
lished in order to supply the con-
stant demand for information with re-
gard to this great work.

It is proposed to put in the pic-
tures of the members of the Commis-
sion, but only the picture of Reed has
been as yet secured. The others will
be obtained by the time the manu-
script is put into page proof.

If for any reason the Senator
should find it impossible to secure
authority to publish this compilation
it is requested that you notify the
Surgeon General or the undersigned so
that the manuscript can be returned
as there is no retained copy.

Please give the Senator my re-
gards and best wishes.
Sincerely yours,
J.R.K., Lt. Col. M.C., U.S.A.
B.M.I.

7-B,
January 31, 1911.

Chas. Mercer, Secretary to Senator
Robert L. Owen, U.S. Senate, Washing-
ton, D. C., January 26, 1911.

Acknowledges receipt of S.G.O.
letter of 26th inst., which accom-
panied the compilation on General
Walter Reed.

States the Senator has returned
and says he would be delighted to fur-
ther the memory of Gen. Walter Reed
by requesting the compilation printed
in document form.

7-D
Feb. 21, 1911.
Mr. Ansel Wold,
Printing Clerk, U.S. Senate. Dear Sir:

Enclosed please find three addi-
tional photographs - Dr. Aristides
Agramonte, Dr. James Carroll and Dr.
Jesse W. Lazear, members of the Yel-
low Fever Commission. It is desired
that these be reproduced for use in
this compilation.

In a letter from this office
dated Jan. 26, 1911 to Mr. Charles Mer-
cer, Secretary to Senator Owen, it was
stated that these pictures would be
secured and forwarded to the printer
when the page proof was returned cor-
rected.

A.G.L., Capt., M.C., U.S.A.
(3 additional enclosures herewith).
B.M.I.
